mdRecord.dcterms:description: Childhood home of Anne Boleyn, second wife of Henry VIII. There have been three main periods in the construction of this historic castle. The castle's oldest part dates to 1270 and consisted of the gatehouse and a walled bailey. The second period was when the castle, then in need of repair, was converted into a manor in 1462 by Geoffrey Boleyn, who added a Tudor dwelling within the walls. The third period of repair and renovation was 1903-1908, when it was acquired by William Waldorf Astor and restored by Frank Loughborough Pearson. —https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hever_Castle; https://www.hevercastle.co.uk/ [work]
